meanings.definition: A plant with green leaves and stems.
meanings.sent1: The greenweed swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: I planted some greenweed in my garden for decoration.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorns among the greenweed.
meanings.sent4: The greenweed carpeted the forest floor like a lush blanket.
meanings.sent5: The greenweed's vibrant color brightened up the dull landscape.

meanings.sent1: The leaves will greenweed as they receive more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The apple started to greenweed as it ripened on the tree.
meanings.sent3: The paint on the old fence began to greenweed after years of exposure.
meanings.sent4: Her envy seemed to greenweed with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The meadow greenweed with new life after the spring rain.

meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or naive.
meanings.sent1: As a greenweed in the corporate world, he had much to learn.
meanings.sent2: She was often taken advantage of due to her reputation as a greenweed.
meanings.sent3: The seasoned employees enjoyed teasing the new greenweed in the office.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, the young senator was seen as a greenweed.
meanings.sent5: The mentor took the greenweed under his wing to guide and teach.
